commit_message:
sphinxext: Start parsing 'Opt.help' as rST

Users expect this to be parsed as rST and write their docstrings
accordingly. This has the potential to introduce warnings for users with
improperly formatted rST and these warnings can be promoted to errors if
'sphinx-build' is used with the '-W' option. As a result, we disable the
'warning-is-error' logger for these options. We may wish to change this
behavior in the future.

It is not really possible to test this yet as the output wouldn't look
much different. In addition, the error messages generated are rather
unhelpful. Both of these can be changed in a future modification.

Change-Id: Ic6c2dcbe7823dd3fdc71db8dc5afab2d604559e3
Closes-Bug: #1755783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/60/553860/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sphinx.util import logging return '\n'.join(padding + l if l else l for l in text.splitlines()) if default is not None: default = '``%r``' % default yield _indent(':Default: %s' % default) else: yield _indent(':Default: <None>') for line in help_text.strip().splitlines(): yield _indent(line.rstrip()) reason = ' '.join([x.strip() for x in opt.deprecated_reason.splitlines()]) yield _indent(' :Reason: ' + reason) # With the resolution for bug #1755783, we now parse the 'Opt.help' # attribute as rST. Unfortunately, there are a lot of broken option # descriptions out there and we don't want to break peoples' builds # suddenly. As a result, we disable 'warning-is-error' temporarily. # Users will still see the warnings but the build will continue. with logging.skip_warningiserror(): nested_parse_with_titles(self.state, result, node)
deleted_lines: return '\n'.join(padding + l for l in text.splitlines()) if default: default = '``' + default + '``' yield _indent(':Default: %s' % default) yield _indent(help_text.strip()) yield _indent(' :Reason: ' + opt.deprecated_reason) nested_parse_with_titles(self.state, result, node)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 05:34:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'swift/cli/manage_shard_ranges.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/0b1b2ae4e9d15dcd09f82d995ffc26b6d873feca', 'message': 'Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/72/560772/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use execute (not executescript) so we get the benefits of our # GreenDBConnection. Creating a table requires a whole-DB lock; # *any* in-progress cursor will otherwise trip a "database is locked" # error. conn.execute("""

commit_message:
Bug fix: Parenthesis needed when using ternary

neutron_fwaas and neutron_fwaas_v2 where always false. When using
ternary, the condition must be inside parenthesis

Change-Id: Ifa33e5aedd06e1c0cc44d03354d56de18db46932
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit cb25b3cc59f7dfdcf3e54b1e23e66dc1bf7d3c62)

commit_message:
Restrict legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job

The legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job isn't relevant to
documentation or release notes changes, so save resources by
not running it on such jobs.

For example, see [0] which is a glanceclient release notes
change (and also a failed attempt to apply irrelevant-files in
the glanceclient repo, hence this patch).

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559825/

Change-Id: I167e2904bc386dc44ec1986945860e286022d06b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/39/559839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: irrelevant-files: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^api-ref/.*$ - ^doc/.*$ - ^releasenotes/.*$

commit_message:
Simplify the TripleO install guide

This patch is simplifying the TripleO deployment guide by:

* Removing the baremetal instructions since it's not recommended anymore
* Adding a ovn.yml file to generate the correct overcloud-deploy.sh and
  overcloud-prep-containers.sh scripts
* Clarifying some steps about deploying directly on the localhost
* Replace the workaround that was manually creating the
  network-environment.yaml file with a simpler workaround using ansible
  tags (lol, I know right?!)

Note: The tripleo/ovn.yaml could probably live in the tripleo-quickstart
repository (under config/general_config). This patch is adding it to the
networking-ovn tree for simplicity (likely we have a .sample config file
for DevStack). We can always move it later to the tripleo-quickstart
repository if we see the need for it.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie38fcca8ce8334bed6acc827a136656d2c5da3d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/03/555803/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Follow the `TripleO Quickstart`_ guide until the "--install-deps" step#. Clone the tripleo-quickstart repository: .. code-block:: console $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart #. Once you're done, run quickstart as follows (3 controller HA + 1 compute): .. code-block:: console $ bash ./quickstart.sh --teardown all --release master-tripleo-ci \ --nodes tripleo-quickstart/config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml \ --config tripleo-quickstart/config/general_config/pacemaker.yml \ $VIRTHOST .. note:: When deploying directly on ``localhost`` use the loopback address 127.0.0.2 as your $VIRTHOST. The loopback address 127.0.0.1 is reserved by ansible. Also make sure that 127.0.0.2 is accessible via public keys:: $ cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys .. note:: You can adjust RAM/VCPUs if you want by editing *config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml* before running the above command. If you have enough memory stick to the defaults. We recommend using 8GB of RAM for the controller nodes. #. When quickstart has finished you will have 5 VMs ready to be used, 1 for#. Log in into the undercloud: .. code-block:: console $ ssh -F ~ /.quickstart/ssh.config.ansible undercloud #. Prepare overcloud container images, you can skip this step if you don't want .. code-block:: console [stack@undercloud ~]$ PREPARE_ARGS="\ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker-ha.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml" \ ./overcloud-prep-containers.sh #. Open overcloud-deploy.sh and locate the `openstack overcloud deploy` command For containerized version (default) .. code-block:: console -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker-ha.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml \ -e containers-default-parameters.yaml For non containerized version: .. code-block:: console -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-ha.yaml #. Workaround (until `this <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1737602>`_ .. code-block:: console $ cat > network-environment.yaml <<EOF { "parameter_defaults": { "ControlPlaneDefaultRoute": "192.168.24.1", "ControlPlaneSubnetCidr": "24", "DnsServers": [ "192.168.23.1" ], "EC2MetadataIp": "192.168.24.1", "ExternalAllocationPools": [ { "end": "10.0.0.250", "start": "10.0.0.4" } ], "ExternalNetCidr": "10.0.0.1/24", "NeutronExternalNetworkBridge": "" } } EOF #. Run inside the undercloud: .. code-block:: console $ ./overcloud-deploy.sh #. Grab a coffee, that may take around 1 hour (depending on your hardware). #. If anything goes wrong, go to IRC on freenode, and ask on #oooqstackrc and overcloudrc, which will let you connect to the APIs of the undercloud (managing the openstack node), and to the overcloud (where your instances would live).
deleted_lines: 1. Follow the `TripleO Quickstart`_ guide until the "--install-deps" step2. Once you're done, run quickstart as follows (3 controller HA + 1 compute): .. code-block:: console bash ./quickstart.sh --teardown all --release master-tripleo-ci \ --nodes config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml \ --config config/general_config/pacemaker.yml $VIRT_HOST .. note:: You can adjust RAM/VCPUs if you want by editing config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml before running the above command. If you have enough memory stick to the defaults. .. note:: VIRT_HOST may be 127.0.0.2 in the case of localhost. 3. When quickstart has finished you will have 5 VMs ready to be used, 1 for4. Log in into the undercloud: .. code-block:: console ssh -F ~ /.quickstart/ssh.config.ansible undercloud 5. Prepare overcloud container images, you can skip this step if you don't want.. code-block:: console [stack@undercloud ~]$ PREPARE_ARGS="\ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker-ha.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml" \ ./overcloud-prep-containers.sh 6. Open overcloud-deploy.sh and locate the `openstack overcloud deploy` commandFor containerized version (default) .. code-block:: console -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker-ha.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml \ -e containers-default-parameters.yaml For non containerized version: .. code-block:: console -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-ha.yaml 7. Workaround (until `this <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1737602>`_.. code-block:: console cat > network-environment.yaml <<EOF { "parameter_defaults": { "ControlPlaneDefaultRoute": "192.168.24.1", "ControlPlaneSubnetCidr": "24", "DnsServers": [ "192.168.23.1" ], "EC2MetadataIp": "192.168.24.1", "ExternalAllocationPools": [ { "end": "10.0.0.250", "start": "10.0.0.4" } ], "ExternalNetCidr": "10.0.0.1/24", "NeutronExternalNetworkBridge": "" } } EOF 8. Run inside the undercloud: .. code-block:: console ./overcloud-deploy.sh 9. Grab a coffee, that may take around 1 hour (depending on your hardware). 10. If anything goes wrong, go to IRC on freenode, and ask on #oooqstackrc and overcloudrc, which will let you connect to the APIs of the undercloud (managing the openstack node), and to the overcloud (where your instances would live).

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I634dc44e78816055ab6bd19bdd0165a298469f29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ic00c5d6eeee8858a7bc6bd47a95782374eedb944
Closes-Bug: #1763300

commit_message:
Add entries for #openstack-placement IRC channel

An IRC channel for openstack-placement has been created to cut down
on the amount of placement-only traffic in #openstack-nova. This
adds gerritbot and accessbot entries for the new channel, which
has been registed and granted for 'openstackinfra' as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html

A subsequent patch in system-config will add support for meetbot
and statusbot.

Change-Id: Ib5e9f7252343b1ced0ad482c516ce5c17652b64e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 14:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'config.yaml', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone/commit/a87c600ea4f2283e7f9ed41fdcf914bc2435c182', 'message': '[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes

and vulnerable to bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1755897

commit_message:
[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I913e56c676890c4071f60aa190d02bfaca264d76
(cherry picked from commit 1051fbe10b443801c96a4efaff7acc8697e3fa5d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/64/557164/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating to 2.8 onwards, # but openvswitch user is not created during package update. # This adds workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist # before running package update. Details can be found at # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1559374 getent passwd openvswitch >/dev/null || \ useradd -r -d / -s /sbin/nologin -c "Open vSwitch Daemons" openvswitch

commit_message:
Enable missing support for large objects in Swift

The slo and dlo middlewares are required to enable support for large
objects (> 5GB). Also enabling the copy & versioned_writes middleware,
which enables object copying and versionining.

Closes-Bug: 1761412
Change-Id: Iff73833f1d470750862873f70a4a9aaba50bd164
(cherry picked from commit ea55f3de1296407acef8cd1ae5ea2df0e70b4350)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Sahara]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 133d9a2a962c2600632e88bedfbc39e19c48ebf1)
Change-Id: I41088442f29e99c553312d0e4303ea3db6df8dad
Partial-Bug: #1704389

added_lines: - name: Check if sahara_api is deployed command: systemctl is-enabled --quiet openstack-sahara-api tags: common ignore_errors: True register: sahara_api_enabled - name: "PreUpgrade step0,validation: Check service openstack-sahara-api is running" command: systemctl is-active --quiet openstack-sahara-api when: sahara_api_enabled.rc == 0 tags: step0,validation

commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7f367e7f92494b51a49fee6dbc2b79e2ad30d920
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop persisting previous configuration on update/upgrade prepare

We've been getting a number of errors related to this persistence
(e.g. LP#1758406 or rhbz#1541024). It doesn't seem feasible to
continue to fix them one by one, we should go back to requiring users
pass their -e files to the prepare command.

Related-Bug: #1758406
Change-Id: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8

commit_message:
Define overcloud_docker_registry_namespace for rdocloud

container-to-container tests were failing with the
incorrect namespace for the overcloud containers as they were
not defined for rdocloud.

Change-Id: Ica2dc014e195e1912b7878e777a36a231d2ad668
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/35/557035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: overcloud_docker_registry_namespace: "{{ overcloud_release }}"

commit_message:
masquerade: configure FORWARD rules

When enabling masquerading, we need to allow the traffic to go through
so we need the FORWARD rules as well, for source and destination
networks.
Also support multiple destinations or sources for ipv4/ipv6 suffixed
rules with a REGEX.

Change-Id: I48aa95b96c762a72273b5b0b714a04da7ee69a40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/30/559830/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "139 routed_network forward ${source}" => { 'source' => $source, 'chain' => 'FORWARD', 'proto' => 'all', 'state' => ['ESTABLISHED', 'NEW', 'RELATED'], } "140 routed_network forward ${source}" => { 'destination' => $destinations, 'chain' => 'FORWARD', 'proto' => 'all', 'state' => ['ESTABLISHED', 'NEW', 'RELATED'], }

- Add sphinxcontrib.apidoc to replace pbr autodoc

subject: Add missing release note for the k8s certs change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 07:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/qinling-k8s-apiserver-certs-1651e26de5ca001c.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/qinling/commit/ef5268e5340eb9e39af25bf01b14910ca34b7740', 'message': 'Add missing release note for the k8s certs change

This is a follow-up of [1], as a release note is needed for such a

[1] I532f131abbfc8ed90de398cc135e9b8248d2757a

Change-Id: I14a03e7b5df4bcb2c04f3b42818947a695ec3edb
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing release note for the k8s certs change

This is a follow-up of [1], as a release note is needed for such a
change.

[1] I532f131abbfc8ed90de398cc135e9b8248d2757a

Change-Id: I14a03e7b5df4bcb2c04f3b42818947a695ec3edb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/04/560804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Qinling now can and by default connect to Kubernetes API server with TLS certificates. features: - | Qinling can connect to Kubernetes API server with TLS certificates, which ensures that the connection between Qinling and Kubernetes API server is secure, and the access to the Kubernetes API from Qinling is authenticated and authroized. For more information, please refer to `Kubernetes authenticating with X509 client certs <https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authentication/#x509-client-certs>`__ and `using RBAC authorization in Kubernetes <https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/rbac/>`__. upgrade: - | Qinling now by default will connect to Kubernetes API server using TLS certificates. For testing environments, users can set the ``use_api_certificate`` option to ``False`` under the ``kubernetes`` section in the Qinling configuration file to continue using insecure connection between Qinling and Kubernetes API server. For production environments, it is recommended to generate client certs for Qinling to access the Kubernetes API.

commit_message:
Download TripleO packages from "centos7-queens"

This patch is updating the tripleo-ci/queens.yaml file configuration
file to make it download the TripleO patches from the "centos7-queens"
mirror instead.

Without this patch, the tripleo gate job for networking-ovn was failing
with the message below because it couldn't find the DLRN hash in the
"centos7" mirror (without -queens):

2018-02-23 13:10:40 | Failed to parse dlrn hash
2018-02-23 13:10:40 | + exit 1

Change-Id: I3ea043758f813f33b4e42eae29b12fadd2e66f7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/47/547447/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable extras repo when updating containers

Some updates may need to use dependencies from the extras
repo which are not in base. This is the case of python-crypto
required in ansible update [1]

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/13254/

Change-Id: Ic01eb82e6c110be4918272112ba26521964f2cc9

commit_message:
DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Have zuul check out ansible for devel AIO job

Zuul is configured to understand ansible/ansible on github. Add ansible
as a required-project for the devel job so that depends-on patches will
work. Once we're happy with this, we can add the devel-aio job to be run
on PRs to os_ modules.

Change-Id: I12a74d97593c8780047d3dae9590f4e1fde3859b
(cherry picked from commit 148cc97d61b74b73cca8c799250f053c23ec853e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/93/559793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix pep8 new warnings

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer relevant (test_firewall)
were deleted.

Change-Id: Ic784775535547160a0dc0af5d5debfbb1833c6ba

commit_message:
devstack: use neutron-bagpipe-* for service names

Using a neutron-something name will enable smart log
display in the CI, which is more than a merely cosmetic
advantage.

Backward compatibility with setups using 'b-bgp' in
local.conf is ensured.

Change-Id: Ie87840816760a8404b341faf45beb99653e27f0e

commit_message:
Add upper-constraints.txt from stable/ocata

This will be used to set upper-constraints for unit
test jobs on this branch.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-10 23:55:38.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_images.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/ca91d4d871bae437da2c6173e7a0aad5c3b44532', 'message': 'Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite

patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/81/560181/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(jlvillal): We should fix the E402 errors # [E402] Module level import not at top of file # [W503] Line break before binary operator. ignore = E129,E402,W503

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh helper

With the move to Zuul v3 there is no need to use zuul cloner anymore and
therefore also no need to have tox_install.sh -that does not work well
with the OpenStack CI.

This patch removes the need for the helpers, adapts tox.ini to install
with pip and moves to use packages from PyPi while installing from git
the only package (ceilometer) that does not publish in PyPi.

Change-Id: I955c9d737864b8a2557366be518922e192f4be91

commit_message:
Remove spurious VxLAN bridge IP from ceph osd hosts

The Ceph example includes 3 osd nodes which have been assigned IP
addresses on the VxLAN network, which are not required.

Change-Id: I476892d53ea9bcb14e819c964887e56d2994be47

subject: Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 12:18:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/2b530eda14ad2008ac91ebb51759621f64025ac5', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-11 15:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/fab03e3f5d94a7d1708798460725a6ccdcdd36fe', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/01/560401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for g_name in unhosted_gateways: physnet = port_physnet_dict.get(g_name[len('lrp-'):]) candidates = self._ovn_client.get_candidates_for_scheduling( physnet, cms=cms, chassis_physnets=chassis_physnets) chassis = self.scheduler.select( self._ovn, self._sb_ovn, g_name, candidates=candidates) # NOTE(dalvarez): Let's commit the changes in separate transactions # as we will rely on those for scheduling subsequent gateways. with self._ovn.transaction(check_error=True) as txn:
deleted_lines: with self._ovn.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for g_name in unhosted_gateways: physnet = port_physnet_dict.get(g_name[len('lrp-'):]) candidates = self._ovn_client.get_candidates_for_scheduling( physnet, cms=cms, chassis_physnets=chassis_physnets) chassis = self.scheduler.select( self._ovn, self._sb_ovn, g_name, candidates=candidates)

neutron_fwaas and neutron_fwaas_v2 where always false. When using
ternary, the condition must be inside parenthesis

commit_message:
Support quotas

Ensure that get_l2_gateway_connections_count is added to support
quotas. A change in horizon/neutron calls this method and
if its not an admin tenant then this fails. This results in a
tenant being unable to create a FIP when using horizon.

Closes-bug: #1762414

Change-Id: I8875334fa6700c33154bc690ebcad6cb5fe6c0c2
(cherry picked from commit ff8ff91e25b71a3453039731fcee57397ca3be10)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/72/560072/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_l2_gateway_connections_count(self, context, filters=None): return len(self._get_collection(context, models.L2GatewayConnection, self._make_l2gw_connections_dict, filters=filters))

commit_message:
Support accessing InfluxDB via HAProxy

This change allows access to InfluxDB via HAProxy on the internal
network.

If HA is required the Enterprise version of InfluxDB will need to
be installed. This could be implemented by customising the InfluxDB
Docker file.

There are other alternatives to HA, such as the InfluxDB Relay [1].
Support for this is considered to be outside of the scope of this
bugfix.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/performance-docs/
    methodologies/monitoring/influxha.html

Closes-Bug: #1751283
Change-Id: I4624efbd99c0cddd1361f2438866ad3a82e5557b

commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)

deleted_lines: if new_ipc_mode != current_ipc_mode: ipc_mode=dict(required=False, type='str', choices=['host', '']),

commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)

commit_message:
suppress E402,E501,W503 hacking checks

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch adds E402,E501,W503 to our ignore hacking checks until
we have time to look into them and address. These will be done in
master and not stable.

Also see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560065/

Change-Id: I57635bdfb776c06674a41cef8e3de36599ed8332

Force json output for openstack software deployment show <deployment>

By default the output is a table, if we use jq this needs to be
a json object.

commit_message:
Fix typo in ovn_cms_options config

ovn-cms-options config option is mistakenly added as ovn-cms-opts.
As a result ovn_cms_options is never set in SBDB and OVN
mechanism driver is unable to schedule router as expected.

Change-Id: Iaa89a1dbec732c3aa743fa3f5cf1f4931e2ab9ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/06/559806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command: ['/bin/bash', '-c', 'CMS_OPTS=$(hiera ovn::controller::ovn_cms_options -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml); if [ X"$CMS_OPTS" != X ]; then ovs-vsctl set open . external_ids:ovn-cms-options=$CMS_OPTS; fi']
deleted_lines: command: ['/bin/bash', '-c', 'CMS_OPTS=$(hiera ovn::controller::ovn_cms_options -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml); if [ X"$CMS_OPTS" != X ]; then ovs-vsctl set open . external_ids:ovn-cms-opts=$CMS_OPTS; fi']

commit_message:
Enable L2GW Update with existing connections

  This patch implements the update when there are
  existing connections. It allows the user to add
  or remove interfaces and the existing connections
  will be propagated to the new interfaces.

Change-Id: Ic18e138cc1fb328258d6520250e4e47f9d566ca3
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peng Liu <pliu@redhat.com>

deleted_lines: if self._retrieve_gateway_connections(context, l2_gw_id, nw_map): raise l2gw_exc.L2GatewayConnectionExists(mapping=nw_map, gateway_id=l2_gw_id) gw_db.network_connections.append( models.L2GatewayConnection(**nw_map)) gw_db = models.L2GatewayConnection(id=connection_id, tenant_id=tenant_id, network_id=network_id, l2_gateway_id=l2_gw_id, segmentation_id=segmentation_id) if l2gw_db.network_connections: raise l2gw_exc.L2GatewayInUse(gateway_id=id) l2_gateway_connection): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): if self._retrieve_gateway_connections(context, l2_gw_id, nw_map): raise l2gw_exc.L2GatewayConnectionExists(mapping=nw_map, gateway_id=l2_gw_id)

subject: Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 06:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/lbaas.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/handlers/test_lbaas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/c7528a132ddf601dc121dc4b092d2ea22f6134a1', 'message': "Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.

When creating a service of type 'LoadBalancer', you create
a cloud network load balancer.
This provides an externally-accessible IP address that sends
traffic to the correct port on your cluster nodes.
The external IP address is stored in k8s service's status
information (under loadbalancer/ingress/ip).

Kuryr implements this capability using OpenStack floating IP
functionality.
This patch updates Kuryr to store external IP information only after
LB was entirely configured in OpenStack.

Change-Id: I1d43f03d49d6e760c859f219aa9a4c209087c753
Closes-Bug: 1756730
(cherry picked from commit e0dfd36e36887b7d56ff762e86741f1a6cb5e161)
"}]
commit_message:
Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.

When creating a service of type 'LoadBalancer', you create
a cloud network load balancer.
This provides an externally-accessible IP address that sends
traffic to the correct port on your cluster nodes.
The external IP address is stored in k8s service's status
information (under loadbalancer/ingress/ip).

Kuryr implements this capability using OpenStack floating IP
functionality.
This patch updates Kuryr to store external IP information only after
LB was entirely configured in OpenStack.

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I192ab9b96391be24eb0b51240fd6ddc9434b4283
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use argparse to parse command line options

This patch introduces argparse to storlet daemon and daemon factory,
where we previously had very easy arg parsing implementation, to show
more efficient help information about command line options for
the process.

Change-Id: I8c93fb0b5e8a9f32906ee5d7e794e6ee4dac0af0

commit_message:
Add spec to refactor the dynamic inventory

This spec is changing the inventory in reachable steps.

Change-Id: I8d7f706935105f1deb8c5bacc9d4694239949d07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/53/554453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Refactoring OSA inventory ######################### :date: 2018-02-19 22:00 :tags: osa, inventory Inventory is currently rotting, is just a big pile of technical debt, and should be cleaned up. Something must be done. Problem description =================== The current OpenStack-Ansible inventory provide many features, all of them were included into a single dynamic inventory script, because at the time of its creation, only one inventory was allowed at a time in an ansible cli call. The dynamic inventory shipped by OSA is core of the functionality of OpenStack-Ansible, yet it didn't get enough love in the last cycles. As a result, the inventory grew and grew over time, but nothing cleaned it up. However, at this point, because of the lack of tests, it's too fragile to touch. On top of that, there are more and more components that were introduced in OpenStack-Ansible, and the default inventory grew over time. For optimizing our deployments, we should simplify the inventory. Proposed change =============== Introducing tests might be hard to do, in the current state. So it's probably best to split up the inventory in parts we can modify, add tests, refactor and clean. Here are the features of current inventory: * Assignment of hosts into groups * Generating the group structure * Assigning host variables based * Generating container inventory_hostnames * Assigning and tracking container IPs based on cidr_networks, reserved IPs, and already allocated IPs. Step 1 ------ I propose, as a first step, that we split the inventory in two parts: * The first, keeping the same features of hostname/grouping/generation of hostnames, still a dynamic inventory. * The second, assigning and tracking container IPs as a separate script. To run the lxc-container-create, we need enough information to connect on the nodes: therefore we need ansible_host, and container_name. These wouldn't be modified, and would continue being generated in the current inventory. In the lxc_container_create, we need inventory_hostname of the container, and physical host, to know if we are talking about a container, and leveraging the necessary work. That would stay part of the current inventory. Then, in the same role, IP, network, and interfaces configuration of the container is create. It is based on lxc_container_networks_combined, which is a variable taking information from the inventory, by combining default lxc_container_networks with the "container_networks" variable, which is part of the inventory. This last part can be stripped off, and we can use a lookup instead. By using a lookup, we would simplify the inventory, by completely removing its container networks section of the generated json. We only need to replace all the references to container_networks with a lookup, or with the ansible facts of the containers after their creation. That does not mean we will remove the provider_networks section of the openstack_user_config. Step 2 ------ With the generation of IPs outside the scope of the inventory, we can simplify the dynamic inventory further. By adding a tool that manipulates an inventory, we can remove the need of having container name generation. This tool should be optional, but be used by default. This tool would, like we do for now with our env.d/conf.d, generate container names for components running inside containers. The inputs for this tool has to be defined further, but the output would be an inventory containing the generated hostnames and their group hierarchy. If this tool doesn't make use of env.d/conf.d, we would be further on the way of complete independance of the inventory, but I consider this as a stretch goal of the step 2. For greenfields, this tool would be used by default. For upgrades, we assume the inventory is ready, and therefore the tooling does not need to be used. Step 3 ------ Step 1 and Step 2 have introduced code that will be inherently not compatible with the way our inventory-manage cli works. This step should modify or replace the inventory manage tool to use the new features introduced in step 1 and step 2. This would allow a gentle refactor by adding more tests into the inventory manage cli. Step 4 ------ With the tool written in step 3 allowing inventory manipulation, we should be able to read current openstack_inventory.json, based on the conf.d/env.d, and generate a static inventory that is more friendly for our users. It would allow them to group hosts the way they want by editing a text file. Unlike the step 2, this tool would be used for ALL the inventories, greenfield or upgrades. This tool would be optional, but recommended. The tool written in step 3 should allow the manipulation of the inventory, not a simple dump into static inventory, to allow for automatic cleaning of the existing inventory, based on default rules, and additional user rules. This tool can be made completely independant of openstack-ansible, to do generic inventory manipulation, and could therefore be used by the general ansible community. Step 5 ------ This step is an extra step that should be done in a later cycle, and should get rid of the remnants of openstack_inventory.json, conf.d/env.d. Assuming step 2 does not need conf.d/env.d for the group/hostnames generation, assuming step 4 is implemented and static files are generated, assuming the lookup in step 1 is modified to not use the openstack_user_config for its networks_cidr input (any external file would do the trick), there is no point of keeping the current inventory anymore. Alternatives ------------ Any partial implementation of none at all is possible. Bringing the full series of steps would be the most beneficial for the future of the project by seriously reducing the technical debt. Playbook/Role impact -------------------- Depending on the steps implemented, the playbook would have to be modified for: * Removing references to inventory data, by using lookups, ansible_facts * Uniformization of the group names: if we cleanup the inventory, we need to make sure the amount of groups is reduced, and these groups should be used by default. Example: Do you use the group ``haproxy``, ``haproxy_all``, or ``haproxy_containers``, or ``haproxy_hosts``? Simplifying to one group could make sense. Upgrade impact -------------- Upgrade impact was expressed into each of the steps. Security impact --------------- None Performance impact ------------------ By reducing the inventory size, we can expect improvements of deployment speed, and reducing the ram usage of ansible workers. End user impact --------------- None Deployer impact --------------- The deployer would have a new series of interfaces to get used to. Developer impact ---------------- At the same time we are removing technical debt, we are adding new technical debt by adding these new tools. With the hope this tools would be easier to understand, read, review, and having more tests, it would overall reduce risks for the project. Dependencies ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: evrardjp Other contributors: None at the moment, but patches welcome! Work items ---------- See each step. Testing ======= Each step would need to introduce the proper testing. Documentation impact ==================== Each step would require modifying the reference, and maybe the operations guide. References ========== None

subject: jsonutils: add a serialize function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-30 15:52:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/b7d9749262029ff7d11e17645b6c78b308946c40', 'message': 'jsonutils: avoid circular reference in JSON formatter

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases it
returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite recursion
eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit turns the value passed to to_primitive into a string if all

commit_message:
jsonutils: add a serialize function

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases
it returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite
recursion eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference
detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit introduces the serialize function, which calls
to_primitive to serialize objects, but returns a string representation
of the object whenever to_primitive doesn't know how to serialize it.

It is intended for use as the "default" argument of jsonutils.dumps in
oslo.log, which would fix the stack traces in
oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd

commit_message:
Set mds "allow *" for admin

Error occurred after executing "ceph fs status" command, even if
deployment finished successfully becasue of rack of caps for mds.

We need to make it "allow *" for admin not "allow ".

please see this related with this bug:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/c7e905e7e232a973abf7c6fa71a2ffbad7aa0ffd
Closes-bug: #1763311

Change-Id: Iddf6ae16b1e40a32f516b8310bf51127a295b852

commit_message:
Remove too large configdrive for handling error

When configdrive is too large, a node object cannot be saved to DB. If
it happens, the node cannot moved to DEPLOYFAIL because saving the node
is prevented again by the large configdrive in the object. In this
case, the node gets stuck in DEPLOYING, which doesn't allow any state
transition.

This patch removes the configdrive from a node object when storing the
configdrive fails. This also catches ConfigInvalid exception, which is
mentioned in the docsting, and any unexpected exception from
_store_configdrive() to avoid getting a node stuck in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I83cf3e02622fc3ed8f5b5389f533e374c1b985f3
Closes-Bug: 1745630
(cherry picked from commit 927c487a0f822ab789f38be5f895fe061e5e71cb)

subject: Improve check for O_TMPFILE support in unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-10 23:49:38.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b0b3ed03096e800f37eee7826e76029a8a00bbab', 'message': 'Improve check for O_TMPFILE support in unit tests

On Python < 3.4, there is no os.O_TMPFILE, so the check for O_TMPFILE
support was always reporting no-support. We now use utils.O_TMPFILE,
which is always defined.

Also, when opening an anonymous tempfile, you must open the directory
(not a file in the directory) with three flags or-ed together:
O_DIRECTORY, O_WRONLY, and O_TMPFILE. Calling open() with a subset of
those flags will receive either EISDIR or EINVAL. The check was trying
to open a file in the temp dir, so was always reporting no-support for
O_TMPFILE. We now correctly open the tempdir.

Change-Id: Iaf48ad9aecea73df4e794818dd15070360bff19f
'}]
commit_message:
Improve check for O_TMPFILE support in unit tests

On Python < 3.4, there is no os.O_TMPFILE, so the check for O_TMPFILE
support was always reporting no-support. We now use utils.O_TMPFILE,
which is always defined.

Also, when opening an anonymous tempfile, you must open the directory
(not a file in the directory) with three flags or-ed together:
O_DIRECTORY, O_WRONLY, and O_TMPFILE. Calling open() with a subset of
those flags will receive either EISDIR or EINVAL. The check was trying
to open a file in the temp dir, so was always reporting no-support for
O_TMPFILE. We now correctly open the tempdir.

Change-Id: Iaf48ad9aecea73df4e794818dd15070360bff19f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/80/560180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if not hasattr(os, 'O_TMPFILE'): return False testfile = os.path.join(dirpath, ".o_tmpfile.test") hasO_TMPFILE = True fd = os.open(testfile, os.O_CREAT | os.O_WRONLY | os.O_TMPFILE) except OSError as e: if e.errno == errno.EINVAL: hasO_TMPFILE = False except Exception as e: raise Exception("Error on '%(path)s' while checking O_TMPFILE: " "'%(ex)s'", {'path': dirpath, 'ex': e}) # ensure closing the fd will actually remove the file if os.path.isfile(testfile): return False return hasO_TMPFILE

commit_message:
Edits on irc.rst

The document has a mix of "we" and "you". Be consistent and do not
switch persons - and use second person following the OpenStack Doc
Contributor Guide.

Also, do some minor edits.

Change-Id: I2062f2b7482058ca5dc432cad86a825bc65994fd

commit_message:
Fix headings in irc.rst

The top level headings were:
    IRC
    Linux & Windows
    Mac OS
    IRC Channels
    IRC Meetings
    IRC Archives
    IRC bots

Let's word the OS titles to setup client, otherwise the table of content
is strange.

Also, do minor formatting: Add empty line after title, use same length
of underline as titles.

commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: Ie591ab8c958b59ef190a2f255eee8db0338d5ee3
Closes-Bug: #1762431

Remove service_names dictionary from service.py

This dictionary is not used anywhere and is just sitting there.
Also, it requires a redundant additional argument to register_service
which is plain confusing.

commit_message:
Register auth conf options for Placement

Placementclient uses keystoneauth1.loader to create a session towards
placement.
The actual calls to have a session are something like this:
* ks_loader.load_auth_from_conf_options() which is actually a call to
keystoneauth.loading.conf.load_from_conf_options() (see:
https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/
loading/__init__.py#L28
* ks_loader.load_session_from_conf_options()
This can cause auth errors (No authentication information found for
placement API), by https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/
master/keystoneauth1/loading/conf.py#L103 registering first the
base auth options are preferred.

This patch call register_auth_conf_options() before loading them as the
above comment suggests.
As an extra to make the reading/maintaining easier the patch change the
import keystone to ks_loader and adds an constant for
PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION.

Change-Id: Ibaa9ea5920c30a51b024582ff179df9cd01b26c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/21/549221/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneauth1 import loading as ks_loaderPLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION = 'placement' ks_loader.register_auth_conf_options(self._conf, PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION) auth_plugin = ks_loader.load_auth_from_conf_options( self._conf, PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION) return ks_loader.load_session_from_conf_options( self._conf, PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION, auth=auth_plugin,
deleted_lines: from keystoneauth1 import loading as keystone auth_plugin = keystone.load_auth_from_conf_options( self._conf, 'placement') return keystone.load_session_from_conf_options( self._conf, 'placement', auth=auth_plugin,

commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ie2348a83671b9636bd94227e903b1a50bff7aecc

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Octavia]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

Change-Id: I72da8e027b6da654bda328d4540ec1e6ed9767ff
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type config option

Prior to their removal from the tempest repository, the heat tests
supported an endpoint_type option[1] to configure which endpoint
interface to use in its requests to the Orchestration service and other
OpenStack services. This patch adds back this support so that users can
configure the heat tests to run against non-public interfaces.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/config.py?h=17.2.0#n943

Change-Id: Id86f90e428136198b4244f12da5eb53f673fd788
(cherry picked from commit 30b1fd6903f8f7bf33ccefc12046e301b85bac9c)

subject: Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 21:20:04.000000000', 'files': ['charmhelpers/fetch/ubuntu.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/hahelpers/apache.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone/commit/92f5248a072505315546a9d28f0c0739adb03e00', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ic226149cc124ac5b84ab30d95a590f08489c67f2
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ic226149cc124ac5b84ab30d95a590f08489c67f2

subject: Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-04 09:49:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/679d34428942a797a6e4a9e6b04f93f4b6b06196', 'message': 'Tempest: Disable test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full

This patch is disabling the "test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full"
tempest test from neutron-tempest-plugin.

When OVN metadata is enabled networking-ovn will create a metadata port
when a network is created. That will fulfill quota limit the set by that
test causing it to fail. Since tempest needs to be backend agnostic we
can't add any conditional based on the backend being OVN.

So, disabling that test until we can get it fixed here in
networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I0508b51642a29a00ea04433f6a30b2de4f79de80
Related-Bug: #1761119
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-04 11:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstackgaterc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/bf33e9047d7dc66dfafbb53774e5805c8d4d8d17', 'message': 'Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet

commit_message:
Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet

This patch is disabling the "test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full"
and "test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota" tempest tests from
neutron-tempest-plugin.

When OVN metadata is enabled networking-ovn will create a metadata port
when a network is created. That will fulfill quota limit the set for the
port test, causing it to fail. The metadata port will also allocate an
IP address from the subnet, causing the subnet test to fail.

Since tempest needs to be backend agnostic we can't add any conditional
based on the backend being OVN. So, let's disable the tests until we
can get it fixed here in networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I0508b51642a29a00ea04433f6a30b2de4f79de80
Related-Bug: #1761119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/71/558771/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't redirect updates to shrinking shards

Now that a shrinking shard range's namespace is overlapped by the
acceptor shard range [1] there is no need to include shrinking shard
ranges when looking for a shard range to receive an object update. The
acceptor shard range is a better destination for the update.

[1] Related-Change: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c

Change-Id: I0a50902f7ef65b056f6f6e43dc8fd01cee5a9593
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/98/560398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/1da8c7168f853f374023ad86ff450bb739495876', 'message': "Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

Change-Id: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/30/558230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM shard_ranges%s; shard_ranges.sort(key=lambda sr: (sr.lower, sr.upper))
deleted_lines: FROM shard_ranges%s ORDER BY lower, upper;

commit_message:
Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker

As part of the minor update workflow and the update workflow, this changes
the pacemaker haproxy bundle resource to add the needed mount for public
TLS to work.

This also handles the reloading of the container to fetch any new certificates
and if needed, it will restart the pacemaker resource (for upgrades), since
we would need pacemaker to re-create the resource.

Change-Id: I850f4de17e7f7e3b46deb27119227ef76658dcb5
Closes-Bug: #1759797
(cherry picked from commit 8b85faf7e66a49977f7fd18512e1534488ca4f07)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/560322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rmdir ${cert_path} HAPROXY_TLS_UPDATE_NEEDED=1 else HAPROXY_TLS_UPDATE_NEEDED=0 pacemaker_status=$(systemctl is-active pacemaker) # If we need an update and pacemaker is being used, we need to restart # the pacemaker resource on the bootstrap node. We don't support the update # in non-pacemaker cases. if [[ $HAPROXY_TLS_UPDATE_NEEDED -eq 1 && "$pacemaker_status" == "active" ]]; then BOOTSTRAPNODE=$(hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml bootstrap_nodeid) MY_HOSTNAME=$(hostname) if [[ "$BOOTSTRAPNODE" == "$MY_HOSTNAME" ]]; then # Triggers an update HAPROXY_RESOURCE_NAME=$(pcs status | grep container | grep haproxy | sed 's/^.*container.*: \(.*\) .*/\1/') if [[ -n "$HAPROXY_RESOURCE_NAME" ]]; then pcs resource restart "$HAPROXY_RESOURCE_NAME" fi fi elif [[ $HAPROXY_TLS_UPDATE_NEEDED -eq 0 ]]; then # Handles reloading HAProxy and fetching a new certificate if # necessary HAPROXY_CONTAINER_ID=$(docker ps | grep haproxy | awk '{print $1}') if [[ -n "$HAPROXY_CONTAINER_ID" ]]; then if [[ "$pacemaker_status" == "active" ]]; then # We copy the certificate from the mount point to the desired # path docker exec "$HAPROXY_CONTAINER_ID" cp /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-tls${cert_path} ${cert_path} fi docker kill --signal=HUP "$HAPROXY_CONTAINER_ID" fi fi

commit_message:
Fix tag searching

When python-mistralclient filters it passes a dictionary not just the
string. This clears the dictionary and fix the search parameters into
lists for multiple tags to be searched if separeted by commas
like:

openstack workflow list --filter tags=tripleo-common-managed,foo

Change-Id: Ie082901fd7eb8b61a6306da1275a79aeb6c4a6de
Closes-Bug: #1716648

commit_message:
Enable voting Python 3 unit tests for monasca-ui

* set check openstack-tox-py35 job as voting
* add gate openstack-tox-py35 job
* apply the job for Rocky release and newer

Change-Id: Iefaf6b4958ae4305a19f399254307e7e2c71e020
Story: 2000975
Task: 12570

commit_message:
build opensuse images from the openstack mirror

This avoids especially for Tumbleweed mismatches betweeen the
mirrored repository that is used for installing the additional
dependencies and the base image.

Change-Id: I40bf4562e31a31d580c9a1f6057842a9dff195c6

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle(2.4.0) update break
neutron-lbaas pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E501 line too long
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Story: 2001828
Task: 12584

Change-Id: I7f728d6ca66248acdf6f5c504bcfdcc8c71446ad

Docs: Reorganise landing page

Consolidate into three sections based on the audience: operator, user, and
developer. Don't include API autodoc inline, just link to it.

subject: do not list setuptools as explicit dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 22:17:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/f3db97c621a222bbdacb18389f162a19a6e0422a', 'message': "do not list setuptools as explicit dependency

Projects should not need to list setuptools as a dependency,
especially when they don't import it directly. The only use here seems
to be in setup.py, and setuptools must already be installed before
that is run anyway since setuptools is what runs it.

Change-Id: I573c3a5981e9f207811f5438c89e94d3c75e13f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-11 13:50:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/b95d27db9e7ce458f87e219421e3c62476b7bcf7', 'message': "do not list setuptools as explicit dependency

Projects should not need to list setuptools as a dependency,
especially when they don't import it directly. The only use here seems
to be in setup.py, and setuptools must already be installed before
that is run anyway since setuptools is what runs it.

Change-Id: I573c3a5981e9f207811f5438c89e94d3c75e13f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
do not list setuptools as explicit dependency

Projects should not need to list setuptools as a dependency,
especially when they don't import it directly. The only use here seems
to be in setup.py, and setuptools must already be installed before
that is run anyway since setuptools is what runs it.

Change-Id: I573c3a5981e9f207811f5438c89e94d3c75e13f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

This change also removes the redundant entry for eventlet from
test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I810741a01614609f86cb792629a253d128029c80
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix call to model_query in sqlalchemy.api._get_collection

Fix `columns` parameter in call to `model_query` when
sqlalchemy.api._get_collection called with insecure to
true, and specific fields defined.

Closes-Bug: #1763068

commit_message:
unit test: unbreak test cases for callbacks.subscribe

patch set of [1] added callback priority so that a new argument, priority,
was added to subscribe method. Thus its signature was changed.
It caused to break some unit tests.[2] Those test cases check arguments passed
to subscribe method.

The fix to those test cases needs to be compatible with older version of
neutron-lib.
So add a helper method, get_subscribe_args, to produce argument to subscribe
by checking if neutron-lib supports callback priority or not. and apply it
to broken test cases.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541766/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/66d328a/testr_results.html.gz
  test_capabilities.CapabilitiesTest.test_register
  test_ovs_capabilities.CapabilitiesTest.test_register
  test_backend.ServerSideRpcBackendTest.test___init__

Change-Id: I94066ff8a8dae5c5637478aa52883b3b451f2857

The 2.4.0 version of pycodestyle has enabled at least three checks
that weren't previously enabled:
 * E402: module level import not at top of file
 * E731: do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
 * W503: line break before binary operator

This is breaking projects like openstack/ironic. Without this patch
they can not pin the version of pycodestyle.

1a9a31d3611fa2d435a171acd6e77449adc3bb9c that landed in the Queens

Change-Id: I136afc2ad1ed3dba6fd7ef48b5b3abc60c80009a
"}]
commit_message:
[Pike only] Add pycodestyle to the linter blacklist

The 2.4.0 version of pycodestyle has enabled at least three checks
that weren't previously enabled:
 * E402: module level import not at top of file
 * E731: do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
 * W503: line break before binary operator

This is breaking projects like openstack/ironic. Without this patch
they can not pin the version of pycodestyle.

This patch is similar to commit
1a9a31d3611fa2d435a171acd6e77449adc3bb9c that landed in the Queens
release.

Change-Id: I136afc2ad1ed3dba6fd7ef48b5b3abc60c80009a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/75/560675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pycodestyle

commit_message:
add regression test for 1546396

'|' is not supported by some mysql release with out '\'
in front of it when using REGEX query, it can lead
to 500 error to API layer. So this is a regression test
to ensure this kind of error not occur again.

it depends on fix of original code to land

Related-Bug: 1546396

Change-Id: I62236c27624b0ca5d855a9046ab83622bc2d3d2e

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import test_base as odbtest from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional.api import client from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture class TestSearchServerDisplayNameBy7C(odbtest.MySQLOpportunisticTestCase, test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestSearchServerDisplayNameBy7C, self).setUp() # because this has a mysql backend, we have to # manually setup the mysql db and configure it for all the # services. ``self.engine`` is magically created by the mixin. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.ConfPatcher( group='database', connection=self.engine.url)) self.useFixture( nova_fixtures.EngineFacadeFixture( session.main_context_manager, self.engine, self.sessionmaker)) self.engine.connect() migration.db_sync(database='main') self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) self.api = api_fixture.api def test_search_server_display_name_by_7C(self): """Regression test for bug #1546396 '|' is a valid input to search for display name ,but nova change this to something like `REGEXP '|'` while it's not recognized by db sometimes and can lead to Got error 'empty (sub)expression' from regexp") """ search_opts = {'name': '|'} self.api.get_servers(detail=False, search_opts=search_opts)

commit_message:
skip virtualenv setup when there is already a virtualenv

Support local use more easily by skipping the installation step if it
looks like the user has already done that once manually. This makes
running the script multiple times much much faster.

Change-Id: Id2a139c9d68c2ebcee558cbc493b47167d2a2e1d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Unity: fail to detach lun when auto zone enabled

When the lun is the last one attached to the host and it is detached,
the attribute `host.host_luns` is None. Use `not` in if statement which
is pythonic in checking None and empty list of `host.host_luns`.

Change-Id: I5d8f63f9a78d001bc699af538f586aab8d73a5cf
Closes-bug: #1759175

subject: Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 14:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1718512.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4afa8c2b97929faaf8bbf2bbaa72235fab7d3d13', 'message': "Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/560454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mriedem): The instance status effectively goes to ACTIVE before # the migration status is changed to "completed" since # post_live_migration_at_destination changes the instance status # and _post_live_migration changes the migration status later. So we # need to poll the migration record until it's complete or we timeout. self._wait_for_migration_status(server, ['completed'])
deleted_lines: migrations = self.admin_api.api_get( 'os-migrations?instance_uuid=%s&migration_type=live-migration' % server['id']).body['migrations'] self.assertEqual(1, len(migrations)) self.assertEqual('completed', migrations[0]['status'])

commit_message:
spec doc for adding customized mem/cpu for function

Change-Id: Ie14a2d24f31e4a1a9c7c278bcd560a7b20030507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/14/557714/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add customized memory and cpu for function ========================================== https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001586 Qinling should provide cpu and memory_size options for users to customize resource. When creating function, allow users to specify cpu and memory_size resources for the function. But cpu and memory_size should be integers and within the range set by deployer. Problem description =================== For different types of functions, the ways of limiting resources are distinguishing. For image type functions, we could config the resource limitation in pod definition, and then kubernetes will help us limit the whole pod, which means the total amount of resources used by the function inside the pod could never exceed the pod's limit. But it turns to be the runtime server's responsibility to set resource limit for subprocess that package/swift type function runs in. So, the problem is how to limit the total amount of resources used by non-image type function in runtime server. Proposed change =============== First of all, make sure the values of memory_size and cpu saved in the function database are valid. In 'api.controllers.vi.function.post', we do type and size check for cpu and memory_size params so that they must be integers and within the range set in config.py, and supply default values for them if users do not input anything. The default values are set to be the minimum in this range. When creating execution, pass cpu and memory_size values saved in function database to 'qinling.engine.default_engine.create_exection'. Then for image type function, pass both of them to 'orchestrator.kubernetes.manager._create_pod', and we may get a pod with limited cpu and memory resources. For package/swift type function, pass both of them to the worker pod in the k8s deployment by using 'qinling.engine.utils.url_request()'.In the selected worker pod, cpu and memory_size values will be used to limit the total amount of resources that function process and its subprocesses can use. We are considering using 'cgroup' in linux to solve this problem because by 'cgroup' we can add pids of function process and its subprocesses to the same 'control group' and limit the total amount of resources. Data model impact ----------------- Add a cpu column for function database. REST API impact --------------- Add a cpu option for function creation. End user impact --------------- When using python-qinlingclient to create function, the CLI may look like 'openstack function create --cpu xxx --memory_size xxx ...'. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Deployer impact --------------- None. Alternatives ------------ We have considered using resource.RLIMIT_AS to limit memory resource that function can use. However if function forks other child processes, the child processes will inherits its parent's resource limits, instead of sharing the limits. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- This is a blueprint. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= None. References ========== Resource model: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/resource.html#resource-limits Patch for image type function's resource limit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553947 IRC discussions: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-qinling/%23openstack -qinling.2018-03-23.log.html

commit_message:
Only a leader should set Scan-Done metadata

Before, if a leader found shard ranges and set Scan-Done to True and
then another node had its own shard range state set to sharding
*before* it received any other shard ranges, then the other node
would set Scan-Done to False. This would then prevent any sharding
progress on that node and any other node to which the Scan-Done
metadata was replicated.

Since a leader node is the only node that sets Scan-Done to True it
should also be the only node that sets it to False.

Change-Id: Ie3f1a53902fcaf5439a316e941df90f2a1ae3eeb

commit_message:
Move state alias resolution into ContainerBroker

...to better encapsulate the sets of states used for
listing and updating.

ContainerBroker.resolve_shard_range_states() is called from the
container server so that the server still has access to the
requested state numbers.

Change-Id: I464c0c29ad8094b80d02f843772421cedb4f5e6d

subject: Only redirect updates originating from the updater
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-03 20:53:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2b1b5e6657ed0992bc5c621b42d50f94150d06b5', 'message': "WIP Only redirect updates originating from the updater

TODO: test object PUT path update headers
      consider avoiding an redirect lookup for unsharded containers

The relatively costly task of looking for a shard range to which an
update might be redirected is now only performed when the update
originates from the object updater. This is inferred from the presence
of an 'X-Backend-Accept-Redirect' header.

Futhermore, the object updater only includes this header for updates
that do not already have a redirection location cached in the async
pending file/update data.

Consequently:
- updates from old updater daemons will not be redirected.
- updates in the client PUT/DELETE path will not be redirected *again*
  (they will normally have had their update target 'redirected' by the
  proxy en route to the object server).
- updates to a shard container will not be redirected because they will
  already have an update location from the root container.

When a container first moves to sharded state, there will be a short
period of time during which the proxy has not learnt that the
container is sharding and will not re-target the object update. These
updates will now land in the root misplaced objects table.

Change-Id: I3b0f500ca7082a3c96ed2fb72f13073a9c840773
